marketNews.title: Wholesales Mobil +2% YoY di Feb-25, Pertama sejak Jun-23
marketNews.content: Gaikindo notes that national car wholesales in February 2025 reached 72,295 units (+2.2% YoY, +17% MoM), marking the first annual growth since June 2023. This result brings national car wholesale sales for 2M25 to 134,144 units (-4.5% YoY), equivalent to 15-18% of Gaikindo's 2025 target in the range of 750,000-900,000 units (vs. 2M24: 16.2% of 2024 realization). Here are some highlights of car sales in February 2025: Astra International's main two brands - Toyota + Daihatsu - recorded a decline in annual sales performance (-5.8% YoY, +13% MoM) in February 2025, worse than the industry realization (+2.2% YoY, +17% MoM), causing their combined market share to drop to 50.3% in February 2025 (vs. February 2024: 54.6%, January 2025: 51.8%). Cumulatively over 2M25, Toyota + Daihatsu wholesales were recorded at 68,421 (-7.5% YoY), worse than the industry decline (-4.5% YoY), so their combined market share for 2M25 fell to 51% (vs. 2M24: 52.6%, 1M25: 51.8%). Among ASII's top 3 main competitors, Mitsubishi recorded the most positive performance with wholesales reaching 8,790 units in February 2025 (+6.6% YoY, +23% MoM), causing its market share to rise to 12.2% (vs. February 2024: 11.6%, January 2025: 11.5%). Meanwhile, Suzuki booked a sales decline to 4,750 units (-4.9% YoY, -4.7% MoM), but the decline level was still better than Toyota + Daihatsu. Wuling and Chery recorded sales surges of +61% YoY and +241% YoY respectively in February 2025. Chery's sales of 1,468 units in February 2025 are the highest since the brand entered Indonesia, driven by the launch of the Tiggo Cross at the 2025 Indonesia International Motor Show (IIMS). Meanwhile, BYD's sales were recorded at 1,399 units, relatively stable compared to the average of the last 2 months. We assess that the relatively good sales volume - enabling YoY growth - was driven by solid IIMS 2025 sales and a slight seasonal demand increase related to Eid al-Fitr shifting to February 2025. IIMS 2025 itself was deemed successful, recording a sales volume increase of +16% YoY to 22,322 units. In our view, the success of IIMS 2025 indicates that consumers are responding to the new models launched, which can support the recovery of national car sales this year.

marketNews.title: Minister of Manpower ordered private and SOE companies to disburse THR a maximum of H-7 before Eid al-Fitr 2025, it cannot be paid in installments.
marketNews.content: The Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, on Tuesday (11/3) ordered private and State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) companies to disburse the holiday allowance (THR) at least 7 days (H-7) before Eid al-Fitr 2025. Yassierli mandated that THR must be paid in full and cannot be paid in installments.

marketNews.title: Consumer Confidence Index (IKK) decreased but remains firmly optimistic, while the current economic condition index (IKE) rose slightly.
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that the Consumer Confidence Index (IKK) in February 2025 decreased to 126.4 (vs. January 2025: 127.2), marking a decline for 2 consecutive months although remaining at an optimistic level. This result was suppressed by the decline in all consumer expectation sub-indices (IEK), causing IEK to drop to 138.7 (vs. January 2025: 140.8). Meanwhile, the current economic condition index (IKE) rose to 114.2 (vs. January 2025: 113.5), although the employment sub-index decreased by 1.5 points to 106.2.

marketNews.title: Goldman Sachs Downgrades Indonesian Assets Due to Fiscal Risks from President Prabowo Subianto's Initiatives.
marketNews.content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. downgraded Indonesian assets, citing increased fiscal risk from a series of initiatives by President Prabowo Subianto. Goldman Sachs cut the rating of Indonesian stocks from overweight to market weight, and lowered the rating of 10-20 year tenor government bonds to neutral. The downgrade was conveyed after Goldman raised its forecast for the 2025 State Budget deficit from 2.5% of GDP to 2.9% of GDP.

marketNews.title: US stock market plummeted amid recession fears.
marketNews.content: The US stock market plummeted yesterday, Monday (10/3) - with the DJIA index -2.08%, S&P 500 -2.7%, and Nasdaq -4% - following mounting concerns over potential recession due to trade war escalation and possible federal government shutdown. Yesterday's Nasdaq drop marked the index's largest daily decline since September 2022. A day earlier, US President Donald Trump refused to predict whether the US could face a recession amidst market concerns regarding his tariffs on US trade partners.

marketNews.title: Delay in appointing civil servants (CPNS) and contract workers (PPPK) causes significant economic loss.
marketNews.content: The Executive Director of the Center of Economic and Law Studies (Celios), Bhima Yudhistira, stated that the delay in appointing CPNS and PPPK will result in a total economic output loss of 11.9 trillion rupiah, based on calculations conducted by Celios using the input-output method. Furthermore, Celios also projects that the policy delay in CPNS and PPPK appointments will cause a potential loss for entrepreneurs amounting to 3.68 trillion rupiah. Previously, the government and the House of Representatives agreed to postpone the appointment of 2024 CPNS selections until October 1, 2025, with PPPK appointments scheduled for March 1, 2026. These appointments are later than the previous schedule, where CPNS appointments were supposed to occur on February 22-March 23, 2025, while Stage 1 and Stage 2 PPPK appointments were scheduled for February 2025 and July 2025, respectively.

marketNews.title: Vietnam's VinFast plans up to 100,000 EV charging stations in Indonesia; Subang factory to operate in 2026.
marketNews.content: The Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, claimed on Tuesday (11/3) that the Vietnamese electric vehicle manufacturer, VinFast, plans to install 100,000 charging stations in Indonesia. VinFast has not yet commented on this issue. Rosan also provided an update that the VinFast factory with a production capacity of 50,000 units per year in Subang, West Java, will begin operations in 2026.

marketNews.title: Freeport-McMoRan hopes Trump declares copper a critical mineral for tax relief.
marketNews.content: The CEO of Freeport-McMoRan (NYSE: FCX), Kathleen Quirk, said on Monday (10/3) that the company hopes US President Donald Trump will designate copper as a critical mineral. This designation would open up tax relief for Freeport-McMoRan, which is needed to increase copper production to offset global competitors. Previously, Trump told the US Congress last week that he would "dramatically expand the production of critical minerals," although he has not yet provided details. Copper itself is widely used from power generation, electronics, to construction.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Nickel Smelters urged to diversify buyers away from China to meet international sustainability standards.
marketNews.content: The Advisory Council of the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association, Djoko Widayatno, stated on Monday (10/3) that they are striving to reduce the dependence of Indonesian smelter industry on the Chinese market, which currently contributes about 80-90% of Indonesia's nickel consumption. Djoko believes that nickel miners in Indonesia must meet international sustainability standards to diversify buyers to alternative markets, such as European countries, the US, and other Asian countries. Previously, in July 2024, the government told Reuters that Chinese companies were in talks with potential investors to reduce their ownership in Indonesian nickel smelters. This step is intended to help the Indonesian nickel industry qualify for electric vehicle tax credits in the US offered by the Inflation Reduction Act regulation.

marketNews.title: Indonesia to build oil refineries with 1 million BPD capacity, part of 21 downstreaming projects worth $40 billion.
marketNews.content: The Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated on Monday (10/3) that Indonesia will build oil refineries in several locations - including Kalimantan and Sulawesi - with a total capacity of 1 million barrels per day. This amount is a twofold increase compared to the previous discussion to build a single refinery with a capacity of 500,000 barrels per day. The construction of these oil refineries is part of 21 downstreaming projects valued at 40 billion US dollars, which will be funded by the Danantara Investment Management Agency. Bahlil himself mentioned that Indonesia currently imports about 1 million barrels per day of crude oil and fuel to meet domestic demand.

marketNews.title: Indonesia has abundant low-calorie coal reserves to support coal gasification projects, but foreign technology reliance remains.
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Mining Professionals Organization, Sudirman Widhy, stated that Indonesia has low-calorie coal reserves of more than 10 billion tons out of a total coal reserve of 33 billion tons, which can support the coal gasification project into dimethyl ether (DME) as a substitute for liquefied petroleum gas (LPG). However, Sudirman said that Indonesia does not fully possess the technology for coal gasification into DME, so it still needs to rely on foreign investment that already has this technology. Previously, in 2023, Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said that the DME project did not require foreign investors. In 2023, foreign investor Air Products and Chemicals Inc. withdrew from the DME project with Bukit Asam. The DME project is reportedly to be funded by the Danantara Investment Management Agency with a cost of 11 billion US dollars, equivalent to approximately 27.5% of the total investment for the 21 downstreaming projects to be funded by the agency.

marketNews.title: KPPU investigates alleged monopoly by PT Pertamina Patra Niaga in non-subsidized LPG sales, noting high profits compared to subsidized LPG.
marketNews.content: The Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU) has begun investigating allegations of monopolistic practices by PT Pertamina Patra Niaga regarding the sale of non-subsidized liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) in the mid-stream market. PT Pertamina Patra Niaga controls more than 80% of the domestic and imported LPG supply. KPPU found that in sales during 2024, PT Pertamina Patra Niaga recorded high profits from non-subsidized LPG sales up to 10 times higher than the profit from subsidized LPG sales. In its review, KPPU will explore the structure of non-subsidized LPG price formation from upstream to downstream.

tickerNews.title: Rukun Raharja Clarifies Divestment of Minority Shares in RATU as Part of Phased Plan.
tickerNews.content: $RAJA: Rukun Raharja stated in a clarification to the IDX that the sale of 4.66% of Raharja Energi Cepu ($RATU) shares on March 5, 2025, is part of a phased divestment plan of 10% of RATU shares, where the company signed a share sale agreement with buyers on January 10, 2025, at a price of 1,175 rupiah per share. RAJA did not disclose the identity of the buyers in the agreement, and the buyers are not obliged to announce ownership reporting as regulated by OJK. The determination of the transaction price of 1,175 rupiah per share was based on the fair value price of RATU at the time the agreement was signed. This transaction is aimed at strengthening RAJAâ€™s capital structure and providing financial flexibility for RAJA to carry out business expansion.

tickerNews.title: Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG) Increases Stake in Merdeka Copper Gold (MDKA).
tickerNews.content: $MDKA: Saratoga Investama Sedaya ($SRTG), the controller of Merdeka Copper Gold, purchased approximately 122 million MDKA shares at a price of 1,405 rupiah per share on March 5, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 171 billion rupiah. After this transaction, SRTG's ownership in MDKA increased from 19.58% to 20.08%.

tickerNews.title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) subsidiary increases stake in Petrosea (PTRO) via share purchase.
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN) through its subsidiary, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, purchased approximately 48.5 million Petrosea shares at an average price of 3,307 rupiah per share on March 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 160.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Kreasi Jasa Persada in PTRO increased from 41.913% to 42.394%.

tickerNews.title: Hartadinata Abadi (HRTA) subsidiary signs term sheet with Bumi Resources Minerals (BRMS) subsidiary for gold refining and trading.
tickerNews.content: $HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi through its subsidiary, PT Emas Murni Abadi, announced that it has signed a term sheet with PT Gorontalo Minerals, a subsidiary of Bumi Resources Minerals ($BRMS), regarding cooperation in gold refining and trading for 5,711 kg. Previously, HRTA in mid-February 2025 had also signed a term sheet regarding cooperation in refining and trading precious metals for 3,600 kg with another BRMS subsidiary, PT Linge Mineral Resources.

tickerNews.title: Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) considers share buyback option following price drop below IPO price.
tickerNews.content: $PGEO: The Director of Pertamina Geothermal Energy, Yurizki Rio, stated on Monday (10/3) that the company is studying the possibility of a share buyback, following the decline in the company's share price since 2H24 to 815 rupiah per share as of Tuesday (11/3) or -6.9% lower than its IPO price. Yurizki mentioned that PGEO management is also reviewing the allocation of funds to be used for the share buyback.

tickerNews.title: PT Dua Samudera Perkasa increases stake in Dana Brata Luhur (TEBE).
tickerNews.content: $TEBE: Dana Brata Luhur shareholder, PT Dua Samudera Perkasa, purchased approximately 39.9 million TEBE shares at a price of 500 rupiah per share on March 7, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 20 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Dua Samudera Perkasa in TEBE increased from 12.5% to 15.61%.

tickerNews.title: Aninditha Anestya Bakrie reduces stake in Ancara Logistics Indonesia (ALII).
tickerNews.content: $ALII: Ancara Logistics Indonesia shareholder, Aninditha Anestya Bakrie, sold approximately 16.9 million ALII shares at an average price of 375 rupiah per share from March 3-6, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 6.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of Aninditha Anestya Bakrie in ALII decreased from 2.406% to 2.3%.

tickerNews.title: Menn Teknologi Indonesia (MENN) new controller plans mandatory tender offer at a premium.
tickerNews.content: $MENN: The new controller of Menn Teknologi Indonesia - consisting of PT Penajam Makmur Jaya and 5 other entities - plans a mandatory tender offer for 1.42 billion (99.05%) MENN shares at a price of 44 rupiah per share from March 15 to April 15, 2025. The offer price is +51.7% higher than MENN's share price on Tuesday (11/3) at 29 rupiah per share. The mandatory tender offer was carried out after MENN announced that these 6 companies had purchased 67% of MENN shares for an undisclosed value from 3 directors and commissioners of the company - consisting of Michael Halim Mulyanto, Edrick Pramana, and Agus Mulyanto - on February 20, 2025.
